Entries.DialogueText: Why, hello and welcome to our little community, dear!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Why, hello and welcome to our little community, dear!

Entries.DialogueText: You can call me 'Granny' if you like. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You can call me 'Granny' if you like.

Entries.DialogueText: Oh, you're giving this to me? Thank you so much, dear. This is a really special gift!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh, you're giving this to me? Thank you so much, dear. This is a really special gift!

Entries.DialogueText: Thank you, dear. I've been looking everywhere for my reading glasses...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Thank you, dear. I've been looking everywhere for my reading glasses...

Entries.DialogueText: My, my! They've become filthy...
Entries.DisplayPattern: My, my! They've become filthy...

Entries.DialogueText: George, dear... Is this the end? It's been a good life, but I'd like to see Alex find his way before departing... {Portrait:Sad}%noturn
Entries.DisplayPattern: George, dear... Is this the end? It's been a good life, but I'd like to see Alex find his way before departing...

Entries.DialogueText: Oh, my dear... I'm so glad everything ended up okay. And my flowers look healthier than ever!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh, my dear... I'm so glad everything ended up okay. And my flowers look healthier than ever!

Entries.DialogueText: The flowers seem to love this rain...
Entries.DisplayPattern: The flowers seem to love this rain...

Entries.DialogueText: Thank you, dear. This brings back such sweet memories...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Thank you, dear. This brings back such sweet memories...

Entries.DialogueText: Oh, I'm sure George would be interested in that!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh, I'm sure George would be interested in that!

Entries.DialogueText: Home-grown tulips make for a lovely springtime gift.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Home-grown tulips make for a lovely spring gift.

Entries.DialogueText: It's lovely to have the old community center back. We have so many memories from the old days... It's a special place.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's lovely to have the old community center back. We have so many memories from the old days... It's a special .

Entries.DialogueText: I'm very happy for you, dear. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm very happy for you, dear.

Entries.DialogueText: Seeing young people in love is heartwarming for old grannies like me.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Seeing young people in love is heartwarming for old grannies like me.

Entries.DialogueText: Next time you marry, make sure it's the right one... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Next you marry, make sure it's the right one...

Entries.DialogueText: That's a very pretty rose, dear. Have you shown it to Emily? It makes me think of her.
Entries.DisplayPattern: That's a very pretty rose, dear. Have you shown it to Emily? It makes me think of her.

Entries.DialogueText: Oh, sweetie... that was so nice of you to put Pam up in a beautiful new house! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh, sweetie... that was so nice of you to put Pam up in a beautiful new house!

Entries.DialogueText: It warms my heart when people take care of each other like that...
Entries.DisplayPattern: It warms my heart when people take care of each other like that...

Entries.DialogueText: Call me a silly old fool... but I think I have an idea who paid for Pam's new house... *wink*
Entries.DisplayPattern: Call me a silly old fool... but I think I have an idea who paid for Pam's new house... *wink*

Entries.DialogueText: Oh my! That's so kind of you, dear. Why yes... I'd love to go to the movies! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh my! That's so kind of you, dear. Why yes... I'd love to go to the movies!

Entries.DialogueText: You go on ahead, and I'll meet you at the theater.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You go on ahead, and I'll meet you at the theater.

Entries.DialogueText: Oh my! What a lovely day. {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh my! What a lovely day.

Entries.DialogueText: Don't mind my husband, George. He isn't very friendly to strangers.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Don't mind my hus, George. He isn't very friendly to strangers.

Entries.DialogueText: If you get to know him better he'll warm up to you.
Entries.DisplayPattern: If you get to know him better he'll warm up to you.

Entries.DialogueText: I'm sure you two could become good friends one day! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm sure you two could become good friends one day!

Entries.DialogueText: Since you're so interested in my husband I'll let you in on a little secret: he really likes leeks! You can find them in the mountains this time of year.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Since you're so interested in my hus I'll let you in on a little secret: he really likes leeks! You can find them in the mountains this of year.

Entries.DialogueText: # {Portrait:Happy} evelynGarden1
Entries.DisplayPattern: # evelynGarden1

Entries.DialogueText: I saw the most beautiful family of butterflies sunning themselves in the town garden yesterday.$k
Entries.DisplayPattern: I saw the most beautiful family of butterflies sunning themselves in the town garden yesterday.

Entries.DialogueText: The good Mayor put me in charge of the town's public gardens.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The good Mayor put me in charge of the town's public gardens.

Entries.DialogueText: I've been working on the town flower beds for weeks, so don't step on them!
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've been working on the town flower beds for weeks, so don't step on them!

Entries.DialogueText: I'll be baking cookies today. I like to make flower shapes in the spring. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'll be baking cookies today. I like to make flower shapes in the spring.

Entries.DialogueText: Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days.

Entries.DialogueText: George spends the whole day in front of that darned television set.
Entries.DisplayPattern: George spends the whole day in front of that darned television set.

Entries.DialogueText: I wish he'd go outside more. Some fresh air would do him good.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I wish he'd go outside more. Some fresh air would do him good.

Entries.DialogueText: I used to love looking at the clouds, but I have trouble seeing them these days.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I used to love looking at the clouds, but I have trouble seeing them these days.

Entries.DialogueText: My eyes just don't work as well as they used to. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: My eyes just don't work as well as they used to.

Entries.DialogueText: It's nice to be so close to the ocean. The sound of the sea makes going to sleep a lot easier.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's nice to be so close to the ocean. The sound of the sea makes going to sleep a lot easier.

Entries.DialogueText: As kids we hunted for seashells after the tide went out. Those were the days...
Entries.DisplayPattern: As kids we hunted for seashells after the tide went out. Those were the days...

Entries.DialogueText: It's nice of you to take the time to visit George and I.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's nice of you to take the to visit George and I.

Entries.DialogueText: Without young people around, we'd age much faster. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Without young people around, we'd age much faster.

Entries.DialogueText: Thank you! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Thank you!

Entries.DialogueText: What was that, dear? I could've sworn you said 'hockey puck'. *sigh* My ears aren't what they used to be. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: What was that, dear? I could've sworn you said 'hockey puck'. *sigh* My ears aren't what they used to be.

Entries.DialogueText: I feel more energetic in this wonderful weather. {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I feel more energetic in this wonderful weather.

Entries.DialogueText: How's my grandson doing? I imagine he's quite happy living on the farm.
Entries.DisplayPattern: How's my grandson doing? I imagine he's quite happy living on the .

Entries.DialogueText: He deserves to be happy... he's a good boy.
Entries.DisplayPattern: He deserves to be happy... he's a good boy.

Entries.DialogueText: George is always a little less grumpy in the summer. The warm weather softens his bones.
Entries.DisplayPattern: George is always a little less grumpy in the summer. The warm weather softens his bones.

Entries.DialogueText: You might not be able to tell, but I can. I've known him for sixty years!
Entries.DisplayPattern: You might not be able to tell, but I can. I've known him for sixty years!

Entries.DialogueText: The good Mayor put me in charge of the town's public gardens.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The good Mayor put me in charge of the town's public gardens.

Entries.DialogueText: I've been working on the town flower beds for months, so don't step on them!
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've been working on the town flower beds for months, so don't step on them!

Entries.DialogueText: I'm going to bake cookies today. They're coconut wonders shaped like little palm trees! Heehee. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm going to bake cookies today. They're coconut wonders shaped like little palm trees! Heehee.

Entries.DialogueText: Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days.

Entries.DialogueText: Be careful out there, dear. You could get sunburnt!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Be careful out there, dear. You could get sunburnt!

Entries.DialogueText: Sweet peas are in bloom right now.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Sweet peas are in bloom right now.

Entries.DialogueText: They've got such a wonderful fragrance, haven't they?
Entries.DisplayPattern: They've got such a wonderful fragrance, haven't they?

Entries.DialogueText: It seems like we always have more visitors when I start baking cookies.
Entries.DisplayPattern: It seems like we always have more visitors when I start baking cookies.

Entries.DialogueText: My mother taught me the recipe.
Entries.DisplayPattern: My mother taught me the recipe.

Entries.DialogueText: With every year I appreciate the seasons more and more. For young people it's easy to let them slip by.
Entries.DisplayPattern: With every year I appreciate the s more and more. For young people it's easy to let them slip by.

Entries.DialogueText: I've been putting raisins in George's oatmeal... but he hasn't said a word. I wonder if he even notices these things?
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've been putting raisins in George's oatmeal... but he hasn't said a word. I wonder if he even notices these things?

Entries.DialogueText: The good Mayor put me in charge of the town's public gardens.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The good Mayor put me in charge of the town's public gardens.

Entries.DialogueText: The fall flowers are delicate, so don't go stomping on them! I know how you kids like to do.
Entries.DisplayPattern: The fall flowers are delicate, so don't go stomping on them! I know how you kids like to do.

Entries.DialogueText: Today I'm baking cookies. They're shaped like little pumpkins. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Today I'm baking cookies. They're shaped like little pumpkins.

Entries.DialogueText: Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days.

Entries.DialogueText: Are you friends with Alex?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Are you friends with Alex?

Entries.DialogueText: Sometime he worries me sick.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Some he worries me sick.

Entries.DialogueText: Oh, hello my dear. I think of you as my own grandson now. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh, hello my dear. I think of you as my own grandson now.

Entries.DialogueText: Oh, hello my dear. I think of you as my own grand-daughter now. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh, hello my dear. I think of you as my own grand-daughter now.

Entries.DialogueText: My eyesight may be poor, but my nose hasn't failed me yet!
Entries.DisplayPattern: My eyesight may be poor, but my nose hasn't failed me yet!

Entries.DialogueText: I can smell fallen leaves and mushrooms. It reminds me of the forests I used to play in as a girl.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I can smell fallen leaves and mushrooms. It reminds me of the forests I used to play in as a girl.

Entries.DialogueText: Be careful you don't slip on the ice, dear.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Be careful you don't slip on the ice, dear.

Entries.DialogueText: Aren't you cold? You should wear a thicker jacket, my dear!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Aren't you cold? You should wear a thicker jacket, my dear!

Entries.DialogueText: This weather isn't good for my joints... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: This weather isn't good for my joints...

Entries.DialogueText: I usually tend to the gardens, but they're covered in snow.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I usually tend to the gardens, but they're covered in snow.

Entries.DialogueText: I still like to check up on them now and then.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I still like to check up on them now and then.

Entries.DialogueText: Today I'm baking cookies. They're shaped like little winter stars. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Today I'm baking cookies. They're shaped like little winter stars.

Entries.DialogueText: Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days.

Entries.DialogueText: We've lived here for over 30 years.
Entries.DisplayPattern: We've lived here for over 30 years.

Entries.DialogueText: We've seen a lot of people come and go. Your grandfather, for one. Bless him... *sigh*
Entries.DisplayPattern: We've seen a lot of people come and go. Your grandfather, for one. Bless him... *sigh*

Entries.DialogueText: Oh... my dear. You have your grandfather's eyes... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh... my dear. You have your grandfather's eyes...

Entries.DialogueText: Yes... yes... I knew him very well.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Yes... yes... I knew him very well.

Entries.DialogueText: You should make some hot soup to stay warm.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You should make some hot soup to stay warm.

Entries.DialogueText: And make sure you wear a jacket!
Entries.DisplayPattern: And make sure you wear a jacket!

Entries.DialogueText: {Farmer_Name}, have I told you that George and I have lived in our house for 30 years?
Entries.DisplayPattern: , have I told you that George and I have lived in our house for 30 years?

Entries.DialogueText: I hope you stay here for a while. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I hope you stay here for a while.

Entries.DialogueText: When I woke up I heard dripping from somewhere... I think the roof might be leaking. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: When I woke up I heard dripping from somewhere... I think the roof might be leaking.

Entries.DialogueText: In the old days, George would've scampered right up and fixed it... *sigh* {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: In the old days, George would've scampered right up and fixed it... *sigh*

Entries.DialogueText: Good morning, dear.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Good morning, dear.

Entries.DialogueText: It was a lovely walk out here... I haven't seen this old farm in a long time. {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: It was a lovely walk out here... I haven't seen this old in a long .

Entries.DialogueText: It looks even better than I remember! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: It looks even better than I remember!

Entries.DialogueText: Here, I brought you a little something.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Here, I brought you a little something.

Entries.DialogueText: It's a gift... from one gardener to another. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's a gift... from one gardener to another.

Entries.DialogueText: Received a 'Garden Pot'
Entries.DisplayPattern: Received a 'Garden Pot'

Entries.DialogueText: These pots are really handy. You can use them to grow crops of any season indoors!
Entries.DisplayPattern: These pots are really handy. You can use them to grow crops of any indoors!

Entries.DialogueText: They also look nice outside... but out here they can only house in-season crops.
Entries.DisplayPattern: They also look nice outside... but out here they can only house in- crops.

Entries.DialogueText: If you need more, they're really easy to make, too... here, I've got an old magazine clipping with instructions.
Entries.DisplayPattern: If you need more, they're really easy to make, too... here, I've got an old magazine clipping with instructions.

Entries.DialogueText: Learned how to craft a 'Garden Pot'
Entries.DisplayPattern: Learned how to craft a 'Garden Pot'

Entries.DialogueText: Well, I'd better go. George gets grumpy if he doesn't have his oatmeal on time...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, I'd better go. George gets grumpy if he doesn't have his oatmeal on ...

Entries.DialogueText: You have a great day, honey! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You have a great day, honey!

Entries.DialogueText: Oh! {Farmer_Name}! You're wondering what that good smell is?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh! ! You're wondering what that good smell is?

Entries.DialogueText: Why, that's nice of you to say! I'm actually baking my famous cookies! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Why, that's nice of you to say! I'm actually baking my famous cookies!

Entries.DialogueText: Here, why don't you try one?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Here, why don't you try one?

Entries.DialogueText: Well, what do you think?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Well, what do you think?

Entries.DialogueText: It's delicious!
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's delicious!

Entries.DialogueText: It was like chewing on a hockey puck
Entries.DisplayPattern: It was like chewing on a hockey puck

Entries.DialogueText: I think I've come to know you well enough to give you my recipe. Just make sure to keep it a secret. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I think I've come to know you well enough to give you my recipe. Just make sure to keep it a secret.

Entries.DialogueText: Learned how to make 'Cookies'
Entries.DisplayPattern: Learned how to make 'Cookies'

Entries.DialogueText: I wish Gus would include a vegetarian option. Some zucchini skewers, maybe?
Entries.DisplayPattern: I wish Gus would include a vegetarian option. Some zucchini skewers, maybe?

Entries.DialogueText: Hee hee... Maybe I should start a collection of clown figurines...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hee hee... Maybe I should start a collection of clown figurines...

Entries.DialogueText: I wish Gus would include a vegetarian option. Some zucchini skewers, maybe?
Entries.DisplayPattern: I wish Gus would include a vegetarian option. Some zucchini skewers, maybe?

Entries.DialogueText: Dear, can you pass the zucchini fritters please? {Portrait:Neutral}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Dear, can you pass the zucchini fritters please?

Entries.DialogueText: This festival has been a tradition for as long as I can remember.
Entries.DisplayPattern: This festival has been a tradition for as long as I can remember.

Entries.DialogueText: Tradition connects us with both the past and the future... it's comforting.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Tradition connects us with both the past and the future... it's comforting.

Entries.DialogueText: Do you have hens on your farm?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Do you have hens on your ?

Entries.DialogueText: Oh, good! I'm sure they lay the most delicious eggs... {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh, good! I'm sure they lay the most delicious eggs...

Entries.DialogueText: Spring would be a great time to start raising chickens, don't you think?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Spring would be a great to start raising chickens, don't you think?

Entries.DialogueText: I've been working on these floral arrangements for a week. Do you like them?
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've been working on these floral arrangements for a week. Do you like them?

Entries.DialogueText: I used to visit this spot when I was younger. It hasn't changed much over the years. {Portrait:Neutral}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I used to visit this spot when I was younger. It hasn't changed much over the years.

Entries.DialogueText: Ahh... The smell of the ocean takes me back many years. Long before you were born.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ahh... The smell of the ocean takes me back many years. Long before you were born.

Entries.DialogueText: Now, don't overeat dear. I wouldn't want you getting a stomach ache.%noturn {Portrait:Neutral}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Now, don't overeat dear. I wouldn't want you getting a stomach ache.

Entries.DialogueText: I remember seeing the jellies once, as a little girl. Oh, how I jumped with joy when they arrived!
Entries.DisplayPattern: I remember seeing the jellies once, as a little girl. Oh, how I jumped with joy when they arrived!

Entries.DialogueText: But that was long ago... I'm a lot less energetic now.
Entries.DisplayPattern: But that was long ago... I'm a lot less energetic now.

Entries.DialogueText: George and I have been watching the jellies come and go together for decades now. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: George and I have been watching the jellies come and go together for decades now.

Entries.DialogueText: Oh, my! Aren't you cold, dear? It's freezing!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh, my! Aren't you cold, dear? It's freezing!

Entries.DialogueText: You are more than welcome to join us at our table, dear. {Portrait:Neutral}
Entries.DisplayPattern: You are more than welcome to join us at our table, dear.

Entries.DialogueText: Did I ever tell you how George and I first met? He actually pelted me with a snowball in this very festival.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Did I ever tell you how George and I first met? He actually pelted me with a snowball in this very festival.

Entries.DialogueText: He was a gentleman back then, and came over to see if I was okay. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: He was a gentleman back then, and came over to see if I was okay.

Entries.DialogueText: You never know... this could be the last time I ever make a snowman with Alex.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You never know... this could be the last I ever make a snowman with Alex.

Entries.DialogueText: Life is short, dear. Make sure to treasure every moment.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Life is short, dear. Make sure to treasure every moment.

Entries.DialogueText: *gasp*... This is absolutely marvelous! {Portrait:Unique}
Entries.DisplayPattern: *gasp*... This is absolutely marvelous!

Entries.DialogueText: You've made an old lady very happy.
Entries.DisplayPattern: You've made an old lady very happy.

Entries.DialogueText: Oh my, it looks wonderful! That's very kind of you.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Oh my, it looks wonderful! That's very kind of you.

Entries.DialogueText: Um, Where will I put this?
Entries.DisplayPattern: Um, Where will I put this?

Entries.DialogueText: ...it smells awful.
Entries.DisplayPattern: ...it smells awful.

Entries.DialogueText: How nice. Thank you, dear.
Entries.DisplayPattern: How nice. Thank you, dear.

Entries.DialogueText: Before this theater came to town, I hadn't seen a movie in twenty years! {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Before this theater came to town, I hadn't seen a movie in twenty years!

Entries.DialogueText: I loved it... now you know why '{0}' is considered a classic.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I loved it... now you know why '{0}' is considered a classic.

Entries.DialogueText: It's very kind of you to invite an old lady to the movies. {Portrait:Happy}
Entries.DisplayPattern: It's very kind of you to invite an old lady to the movies.

Entries.DialogueText: I'm glad they're still making decent movies... I had a lot of fun!
Entries.DisplayPattern: I'm glad they're still making decent movies... I had a lot of fun!

Entries.DialogueText: I've never been a fan of scary movies, but I'll try to keep an open mind.
Entries.DisplayPattern: I've never been a fan of scary movies, but I'll try to keep an open mind.

Entries.DialogueText: Is it over yet? {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: Is it over yet?

Entries.DialogueText: Evelyn is covering her eyes.
Entries.DisplayPattern: Evelyn is covering her eyes.

Entries.DialogueText: I had to close my eyes during most of it... {Portrait:Sad}
Entries.DisplayPattern: I had to close my eyes during most of it...

Entries.DialogueText: Ah... the sands of time, the sands of time...
Entries.DisplayPattern: Ah... the sands of , the sands of ...

Entries.DialogueText: Hello dear. Please take your time, I'll be here all day!
Entries.DisplayPattern: Hello dear. Please take your , I'll be here all day!
